review.des:
A nice rooftop overlooking some of the more popular landmarks in Chicago.  It's a great place to go to grab a drink before heading elsewhere.  However, there are a ton of rooftops in Chicago that have a way better view and are not as consistently crowded in my opinion.  My favorite thing about this place is watching the Navy Pier fireworks from the terrace, if you time it right and find some space to stand it's a great moment.  
Their cocktails are good, but for the price I think they can make them a little stronger. I've never tried the food, but I've heard from others that it's good as well!

My friends and I decided to have brunch at this place while we were visiting Chicago for the first time. When we arrived, we weren't welcomed or greeted by the hostess. When we told her we did not have a reservation, she gave us the menu and asked if we still wanted to dine in.. Umm that's why we're there.. We said yes, and she gave us a table that was facing a green tree. We went for the view and got just grass up in our faces. We all sat horizontally next to each other so it was hard to communicate. We decided to go back up to the hostess to see if there was any other table available. She was on the phone so we told another host. She heard us asking the other host (while talking on phone), and just replied "No". Not even a simple explanation or an apology. Just a plain, rude "No". Hostess/host has the responsibility of making customers feel welcomed and we got ZERO. Yes, it's a great place to dine with a beautiful view, but customer service is key. We walked out of there with disappointment of this hyped place all because of that one hostess.

P.S. She was rude to other customers too. Other customers made eye contact with us and gave us that look. Didn't see her smile once.. Like how is she the hostess?! Everyone else was nice. She clearly doesn't belong there.

Cindy's rooftop restaurant. Such a beautiful view. The vibe here is amazing, everyone is so nice. The ambiance overall was just relaxing and with a great view of the city. But that's not why you're here.. so let's get going on the food review.
Drink: I'm fancy (take me to Costco and try all the samples fancy.. jk) so I tried a peach lavender kombucha, came in a very classy glass (extra AF kombucha) but it was good, you can definitely taste the slight hint of lavender but it wasn't over overwhelming.
Food: Chicken Malanese... did you read about my pineapple obsession review? Well, I'm also obsess with anything and everything fried chicken, and this was the best fancy ass chicken I've ever had. It was juicy and tender and the veggies and sauce that came with it was delicious.
Pork sandwich: it was really good with the perfect amount of seasoning and the chips that came with it was no regular chips.. it was like homemade chips. Tasty.
Definitely give this place a try, it's a must!

Little pricey for a rooftop bar. I paid $14 for a rosè before tip. But the view is amazing! They also have an outside deck place and they have a fire pit that about 12-14 people fit around which is great for chilly nights. They also have a nice big booth that fits about 6-7 people to chill. The inside is also pretty big and they have plenty of tables to sit with no matter your party size.

*bar review only*

I've been here maybe twice and each time I'm lucky to score a spot at the bar...l have never actually purchased food from Cindy's but it all looks delicious as I watch it pass by the bar!

The beer selection is awesome, and the cocktails are pretty delicious as well. The only downfall that I had was I felt the prices were a bit high...but then again it's located right next to millennial park so that should be expected!

The standing area outside is why everyone comes to this place to have a cocktail after work because it is honesty amazingly beautiful. I will say that some of the patrons are rather oblivious to how much space they are taking or the amount of elbows that you without a simple I am sorry.

Hopefully I get to come out and actually try the food eventually!

Only came for drinks on the rooftop, we were eating at shake shack and then the line died down and we saw our opportunity. Had a quick 5 min wait and then headed up the elevator and went to the outside bar and standing room. Got some cocktails, waited a few minutes for a railing spot as it wasn't busy and enjoyed the breathtaking view. The prickly pear drink was delicious!

I had such a great time here I'm not even sure where to begin! The inside of Cindy's is beautiful, high ceiling with windows, string lights, and flowered tables. There was a wait to be seated at a tables but if you're just getting a drink you can go to the inside or outside bar. It had just started raining after we got there so the outdoor bar closed for the evening. My friend and I drank a friesling (alcoholic slushy, how cool is that?!) and a Leila. We really enjoyed both drinks, despite the number of times I got brain freeze. The bar tenders were awesome, they were helpful and gave us a good laugh. Shout out to Edgar for making our awesome drinks. The view was beautiful and we had a great time outside despite a little bit of rain.

It's a beautiful restaurant with a great view of the bean and the skyline. Our waiter, Brian, was soo friendly and kind!!! He made our experience here increíble. We will definitely come back. The Brussels sprouts were great and the sauce they put on them is superb. The chocante pastry dessert is awesome too! It's filled with cream and topped with ice cream! Nothing better.

I came here for a work happy hour and my goodness the views of Chicago are stunning! Since I was fortunate not to pay out of pocket I enjoyed their cocktails and wine options, but this is one of the pricier places you can go to grab a drink downtown. I would recommend Cindy's over places like the signature room or any views from the sears (Willis) tower though because of the amazing view of grant park
I absolutely loved it and how they had all these different rooms in the building. Great space for a cute date for sure

The views and bartenders are to die for!  My friend and I stopped by for brunch on a Saturday afternoon without a reservation...oops!  We were placed on a waiting list which we were told could be over a hour and half. We ended up finding a spot at the bar and we were happy to sit there to eat.  Our bartender...forgive me husband I forgot your name...was amazing.  He was so funny and sweet.  Very quick to get all of our items. We were even interested in trying this Aperol Spritz drink that everyone was ordering but we were afraid we would not like it.  I tried this drink when I was in Greece and hated it but thought maybe they made it wrong...  He made a smaller version for us to try anyways.  Long story short we hated that nasty drink but others loved it and it was so nice of him to make us a sample.  

The miss for me was the menu/food.  The menu was very limited and nothing on it really sounded that great.  We ended up with the CHILAQUILES which was not very good and $27 which is outrageous.  I would skip the food ...at least at brunch...but go for the drinks, view and awesome staff.

Noticed this rooftop from millennium park and was curious enough to go upstairs and check it out! Came here around 4pm on a Tuesday and it was reasonably packed. It was a little hard to get a spot facing the view but with a little persistence and waiting it was possible. The bar was also packed but once we got to push our way through we were finally able to order.

I got the Leila - which is known as one of their top selling summer drinks! Tasted flowery and was pretty much what I expected. Loved the vibe and of this place and can see it being somewhere people come to socialize after work. From what I know it's one of Chicago's hot spots for sure!

Beautiful rooftop bar , nice view of the lake and millennium park.

The food was alright but drinks were great. We ordered grey garden drink very fresh I love it.

The thing that I give 4 starts because our service very slow my friend would like to order drink but no body come to our table.

Overall, good for the view
Wow what a view. This place is high class and definitely a place to impress your friend z. Had a lovely adventure at this place. Next time will try to go to the only 8
Good drinks, a great vibe, nice clientele, and an unbeatable view.  Definitely worth checking out when the weather is nice enough to enjoy the outdoor rooftop.

Cindy's was a great place to grab a drink with a great view. The drink menu is extensive and there are a lot of great cocktails.
I had the welcome back cocktail and it was as advertised - a different take on a Moscow mule. It was refreshing, well crafted, and strong.

The view was amazing as well. The outdoor seating/standing area has a great view of Millennium Park. The indoor area is also cute and well laid out.

The reason for the 4 star review was that my drink was $16 which seemed excessive. I suppose I am paying for the view which makes sense but it was still a little shocking.

This review is purely for the drinks and the view.

My parents and I came here over the summer. It was a beautiful day. There was a long line for the elevator since there's only one that goes up to he rooftop, but we didn't mind. We waited for about 15-20 minutes. If you go there for drinks, there's no wait upstairs. If you want to eat, you have to wait a bit longer.

The place was packed and everyone seemed lively. I ordered the Howl at the Jun cocktail and my mom ordered the Virgin Pillar. Both were refreshing and sweet. It's on the pricey side but that's what you can expect from a Chicago rooftop bar. The cocktail filled up most of the large wine glass so I thought it was worth it.

The interior is beautiful and their view of the city is breathtaking. I'm not going to post the picture because you MUST see it for yourself!! ;D

If you are looking to take in the views of the city....this is the place to go.  You can walk up stairs or take the elevator to the top floor. Seated dining is an option, but you really want to do is grab a cocktail and walk out to the patio overlooking the park, lake, and breathtaking views that the city has to offer from the north to the south.  You can see Indiana and probably even see Michigan on a clear day.  This place is a great venue to take a step away from the hustle and bustle of the busy city and breath in Chicago.  I look forward to going here with friends and sharing this with new friends.  This is worth the stop if you find yourself on Michigan.  Bike parking on street.

This cute rooftop restaurant is the perfect spot to have a nice casual date. Decor is clean and beautiful when the suns out. The food was phenomenal!
I had the farm spinach and kale salad with salmon. The salmon taste fresh, seared and seasoned to perfection! Salad is well balanced, refreshing and what I consider clean eating! After having loads of pizza, this was the cherry on top during my mini trip to Chicago. I had a couple bites of the lobster roll, it's refreshing! The Asian pear gives off a nice crunch texture to the sandwich. Most lobster rolls are heavy in butter and fattening, rather Cindy's offer a nice light lobster roll and feel less guilty eating it lol.

Overall,
Service is very fast and attentive, The staff is amazing, and of course chef ragano is awesome! It's really nice knowing the food matches the quality of the people and restaurant itself. Thank you for the wonderful experience.

After lunch, I needed to walk. I love rooftop bars, so even though it was cold AF, I made the roommate walk over a mile in the freezing cold to go to Cindy's. We got here on Tuesday, December 5th around 12:15pm. We didn't have a reservation, but we headed straight to the bar and grabbed two stools.

*The Old Fashioned: russell's reserve 10 yr, demerara syrup, angostura bitters, orange peel ($16)
*Eagle Rare 10 yr ($14), Manhattan (+$2)

Nothing on the menu called to me, so I just got an Eagle Rare Manhattan. It was nice as it wasn't too sweet. (Sometimes Manhattans can be too sweet for me.) The roommate isn't much of a cocktail drinker, so he got the old fashioned. I don't think he liked it, but he knew I really wanted to check out the patio area, so he bared with me. We finished our drinks at the bar and then headed outside. Their patio area has firepits, so on a normal day, the cold would probably be bearable. But on this day, it was so cold, I just took my pix and video and went back inside. It was that cold! The view is amazing. You get Millennium Park and the water. So pretty!

Great spot to enjoy a cocktail and the views. On a nice day, it would be fun to sit outside and just take in Chicago. Such a beautiful view!
